result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William J Bustos

records.addlTxt: At the request of defense, court converts plea hearing to a status conference.

Defendant William J Bustos in court.  Attorney Caleb C Katz in court for William J Bustos.  Attorney Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a scheduling  conference. Defense received an offer and request status conference date to allow time to review the offer with his client. No objection from the state. Court adjourns matter for a plea hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Plea hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant William J Bustos in court with attorney Caleb C Katz in person.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 11, Judge Swanson. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 11.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8-16-2022
Received and Filed: Attorney Caleb Katz
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel.  Received and Filed.  nk

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Defendant to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.  No driving without a valid license and insurance.

Defendant William J Bustos in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant William J Bustos in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  William J Bustos appeared by video means with Attorney.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Swanson, Branch 11.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 8:30AM.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
